resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
raulcd opened a new pull request, #12947:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12947

   As discussed on https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12902#issuecomment-1102750381 there is an issue on the Kartothek integration https://github.com/JDASoftwareGroup/kartothek/issues/515
   This PR aims to skip the failing tests.

raulcd commented on PR #12947:

raulcd commented on PR #12947:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12947#issuecomment-1106366838

   @jorisvandenbossche even though we are skipping more tests than the ones that failed (as seen on the logs) I think this is better than fully removing the kartothek integration. There are some job failures but don't seem to be related to the change. Let me know how can I trigger a new run of the failed jobs if you think it's necessary.
   I think this is ready for review.

jorisvandenbossche closed pull request #12947: ARROW-16262: [CI][Integration] Skip failing tests from kartothek integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12947

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

fields.description:
Caused by ARROW-7350, see discussion at https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12902#issuecomment-1102750381. Example of failing build at https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/6071471966?check_suite_focus=true

Upstream issue at https://github.com/JDASoftwareGroup/kartothek/issues/515

On the short term, we should also fix our nightly builds (either temporarily disabling them altogether, or ideally on skipping those failing tests)
fields.summary: [CI] Kartothek nightly integration build is failing because of Parquet statistics date change
